definition[0]: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made
example[0]: the importance of allocating resources to local communities
example[1]: You should allocate the same amount of time to each question.
example[2]: One million dollars was allocated for disaster relief.
example[3]: Several patients were waiting to be allocated a bed.
definition[1]: to decide officially that a particular amount of money, time etc should be used for a particular purpose
example[4]: The company has allocated funds for the design of four plants.
example[5]: Directors allocated $100 million to the search for oil.
definition[2]: to decide officially that something such as a house or job should be given to a particular person
example[6]: Their job is to allocate homes to ordinary people.
example[7]: They allocated me a window seat at check-in.
definition[3]: to decide where a particular amount, cost, or expense should be held in a companyâ€™s accounts
